dialogues.text: No. The redhead walks closer as Greg backs the car up and pul out of the school lot. No one sees her, except us (and probably only some of us). Paul sees Jay and Greg share a moment of eye contact. Gre rubs Jay's shoulder for comfort. Paul makes a face - slightly irritated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg's car pulls up in front of a large upper-middle-clas house on the more rural edge of the county. Well manicure lawns enhance the neighborhood's stature. Jay climbs out of the car and walks up to the front door. friends pile out of the car and stand around it, like a r gang from a B-picture version of "West Side Story". Jay rings the bell and waits. She looks down the street - watching the empty road. The door opens and a friendly middle-aged woman in a rump shirt and "mom jeans" greets Jay. MRS. REDMOND smiles and looks to her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MRS. REDMOND
dialogues.text: Hello. Jay stares at the woman - taken aback. Mrs. Redmond is a ringer for the naked woman seen earlier at the abandoned warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Hi. Um. Is Jeff here?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. REDMOND
dialogues.text: Yeah. He is. Um... Do you wanna come in?

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Mrs. Redmond glances back at Jay's friends by the car.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. REDMOND
dialogues.text: Your friends?

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: That'd be great. Jay waves her sister and friends over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Redmond leads Jay and her friends down a long hallwa the back of the house. They reach a doorway. Mrs. Redmond knocks.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. REDMOND
dialogues.text: Hey Jeff, you got friends here. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. REDMOND
dialogues.text: Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yeah mom. I'm coming. The door unlocks and opens. Jeff looks out past his mom t Jay and her gang. His face reveals the awkwardness and st of the moment. He tries to hide it from his mother.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Hey. Jay looks back at him - waiting for something. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. REDMOND
dialogues.text: Well I'll leave you kids alone. Mrs. Redmond walks back down the hall. Jeff looks at Jay. She stares him down. No one notices, but on Jeff's left wrist, the edge of a bandage peeks out from under his long sleeve shirt.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: You wanna come in? Jay shrugs and steps into Jeff's bedroom. Paul, Kelly, Ya and Greg follow. Jeff appears uneasy. Jay looks around the room. It's a very typical boy's bedr probably too immature for Jeff. Tired, Yara lays across the bed and watches the scene unf Greg closes the door, blocking Jeff in. He hovers near th young man as though he's about to punch him. Seeing that he's trapped, Jeff looks over at Jay.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Jay ignores him - looking at a small, candid photograph o Jeff's dresser. In the photo-booth strip: Jeff smiles alongside a laughin happy young woman: Annie.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: You don't know how horrible I feel. Greg smacks Jeff in the face.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Jeff does nothing in return. He has tears in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Are you gonna call the police?

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: I'm not sure yet. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (his voice is weepy and weak) Please don't tell my family. Ok?

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: I just want to know what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Ok, but can we talk outside? It's not safe in here. It's really not safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff sits before an open expanse of lawns and landscaped backyards. There are no fences here. On the grass at the edge of the patio, Jay and her friend around the host - like a teenage mob. They're drinking so pop from straws. Mrs. Redmond steps outside - smiling. She sets out a tray baked snacks for the group.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. REDMOND
dialogues.text: Ok. I hope you like puffed crispy treats.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Thank you. Yara grabs a crispy treat and begins to eat.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. REDMOND
dialogues.text: Of course. You're welcome. The kids nod awkwardly as they sip their cola beverages. mother smiles and walks inside, carefully sliding the gla door closed. Once gone, all expressions change. Jeff maintains a low whisper, trying to conceal the situation from his mother. eyes are red from crying.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (looking at Jay) Even though it's following you, I can still see it... it's not done with me either. It just wants you first. Like I told you, all you can do pass it to someone else. Jay picks at the ground, pulling up a blade of grass and tearing it into smaller strips, placing them on her leg. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you talking about? Further down the block, a TEENAGE GIRL IN A SOCCER JERSEY appears, cutting across the neighbor's back lawns on her home. For now, she appears as a dot on the horizon - too distant to be seen by anyone.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: She can do the same thing I did. It should be easier for her. She's a girl. Jeff turns and looks straight at Jay.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Any guy would be with you. Just sleep with somebody and tell them to do the same. Maybe it'll never come back. Paul stares longingly at Jay from behind his can of soda. see the figure of the soccer girl begin to take shape in distance. A casual stroll - a backpack slung over shoulde

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Is that really possible?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Total fucking bullshit. Jay pulls apart the blades of grass within her palm - fix on the tiny details of the plant.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: (looking at Jeff) You should take it back. Jeff looks at Kelly - making a face.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: (to Jeff) You know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: It doesn't work that way.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: (almost to herself) I would never sleep with him again. Greg exhales - growing frustrated with the nature of the conversation. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: This isn't real. I promise you the whole thing is some fucked up game. Jeff looks at Jay - her melancholy profile - down-turned. her shoulder, he finally notices the teenage soccer girl walking in his direction - still far away. The camera zoo on the girl. Jeff is clearly distracted and frightened.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I'm not safe either. OK? We shouldn't be in the same place. You need to get the fuck out of here.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Watch it. Jeff glances back to the soccer girl. She strolls lazily across the lawns. A bit closer.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (getting nervous) If it kills you, it comes back to me and then all the way down the line to whoever the hell started it. Jay stares down at her hand - losing herself in the sligh movement of her flesh and fingers - something grounded an real. Paul watches her with sadness and longing.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (nervous and quick) Jay, I'm sorry. I wasn't trying to hurt you. Somebody did this to me too, ya know. Greg is sweating now. He steals another look at the socce girl. She looks back at him - then looks down.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Who did it to you?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (nervous ) I met a girl at a bar... it was a one night stand... I don't even know her name. I think that's where it came from. Greg rolls his eyes in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Jeff? I don't believe you... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jeff focuses completely on the approaching girl. He's fidgeting - ready to stand and run.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: She might, but I think you're a liar. This is some fucked up shit you're - (doing to her). Jeff interrupts -

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Do you guys see that girl right there?!? Jeff points and stares in the direction of the passing so girl. Everyone turns around and looks at the shy teenager bobbing her head to the music. She notices and makes a wo face, shifting her path away from Jeff and the group.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY, PAUL, JAY GREG YARA
dialogues.text: (simultaneous) (nodding) Yes.... Yeah... Uh huh... Jeff regains his composure. He tries to adjust.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Ok. Good. Um... listen... Jay... Jeff faces Jay directly.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Wherever you are, it’s somewhere walking straight for you... but it is walking. If you drive far enough, you can buy yourself some time to think... decide if you wanna give it to someone else. Jay glances down at the ground, as Greg and Paul sit sile Paul steals a look toward Jay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg drives - staring at the dark road ahead. Yara snores the passenger seat - an open bag of potato snacks on her (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Paul, Kelly and Jay are crammed in the back, along with t luggage.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: (to Greg) Um... Greg?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Your mom’s not gonna freak out?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: She won’t even know.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: It’s really nice of you.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I love coming up here. My dad used to take me hunting a couple times a year. It’s not like super nice, but it’s cool. Kelly nods and smiles, leaning closer to Jay.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: (whispering) Have you thought about what he said? Jay takes a pill from her purse.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: (whispering) What?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: (whispering) Maybe passing it on? Jay shakes her head as she swallows the pill with some wa

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: (whispering) I don’t know. Kelly shrugs a bit. Paul peeks at Jay out of the corner o eye - under the cover of sleep. Highway signs pass by. Miles of road.  79 80 81 82 83 84 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg's car drives up the scenic, northern stretch of I-75 Giant stretches of forest and clear lakes line the road. The sun rises higher over the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg's car arrives in front of a lake house surrounded by fields. Beyond the house is a medium-sized lake. The gang start to climb out, stretching in the morning su Greg unlocks the door and steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay and Paul string bells and bottles over the windows an doors. Sitting on the floor - threading old soup cans wit string, Jay speaks into an old 70’s-style phone receiver.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello, yes, um, this is Mrs. Height. I’m calling to let you know that my daughter Kelly is sick with the flu and she’s gonna be out for a few days - uh maybe longer. (beat) Uh huh. Yeah. I know. It’s the season change I guess. (beat) Ok well, thank you. Bye. Kelly fries bacon at the stove, while making pancakes for group. She watches her sister from across the room. A radio on the counter plays an old AM rock tune. Yara dances by herself to the music, snacking on bacon as reads her ebook. Swaying and stepping - her moves are intentionally silly. Greg drinks a beer on the couch, staring at Yara's ass whenever possible. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Family photos of Greg and his parents line the walls. Old remnants of joyful times litter the room. Hanging up the phone, Jay stands at the edge of the kitch looking out the window. She watches the empty field, driv and lake. Birds chirp happily in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg unlocks the door to a shed behind the house. He pull metal case from the dusty shelf. Inside, he finds a small HANDGUN and some bullets. Greg closes the case, and tucks it under his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg stands next to Jay as she fires the handgun at a far row of canned goods and mini cereal boxes. He helps to adjust her aim. Kelly and Paul watch from the distant grass - as shots ri out and echo. Yara reads from her phone. Paul seems irritated.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: It sucks sticking around after everyone's gone, huh?

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: It's a bit lonely.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I'm right across the street you know.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: I remember. BANG! A full size box of Fruity Fun Cereal is hit, causin trickle of colorful rice to pour from the bullet hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat is anchored in the center of the lake. The water calm. The breeze passes like a whisper across Jay's bangs. She turns onto her back and lays out across the front of the feeling the warm sun. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Greg dives into the water, while Paul cannonballs in. Kelly sits near her sister, while Yara dips a toe in the from the safety of the rear ladder - sipping a beer and e snack chips.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: I feel safe out here.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: We'll stay as long as we can. Mom doesn't care.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: I wonder how long it'll take before it gets here.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Jay, there's nothing coming, ok? Jay looks back towards the shore and watches the tree-lin the open field. She stares deeply at the land. Nothing moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yara dives underwater, kicking her feet above the surface Loud splashes. Kelly holds on to the anchor-rope, floating calmly on her back. We notice Greg glancing over at Kelly, treading water wit beer in hand. Jay swims alone. Drying his face with a towel, Paul watches her from the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We slowly push forward - moving up along the expressway. race towards us - passing on either side. We creep along, unfazed by their proximity. Closer and closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trees pass as we move very slowly but steadily throug forest. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The wind howls. A bird flutters past us. Distant lightning illuminates the woods. Thunder rumbles. We move closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bell rings. Jay turns and sees Paul step through her doorway. He closes the door with a final rattle and ring. Jay stares up at him from her bed. Rain pours against the window.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Hi. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Um... I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Yeah. Paul sits down on the side of her bed. He looks over and her. She glances back. There's a silence in the room. Jay shifts under her cover Paul reaches over and holds Jay's hand. They sit in silen Jay stares down at their hands - intertwined. She appears bit uneasy. Paul leans down and tries to kiss Jay. She pulls her head away.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: No, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: What? Jay doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I know you feel kind of alone and I just wanted to tell you that... I'm here for you.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: I know. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Paul takes a breath. It's getting awkward.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: No, I mean... I'm here for you. Paul places his hand on Jay's leg. Finally understanding he's saying, she politely moves his hand away.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Oh... um... Paul, I... Paul swallows hard as Kelly knocks on the door. The bell rings as she walks into the room. She's in a towel. Seeing Paul, she rolls her eyes and giv him a shake of her head.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Out. Jay smirks as Paul leaves the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain pours from the gutters on the ground. Drops ping off the side of the awning. The lake dances with volatile drops of water. Rain falls across the windows of the lake house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grey mist has settled over the area. Jay relaxes on one of the lawn chairs in the center of th field - near the lake. A breeze tussles her hair. She app calm, but sad. Kelly, Greg and Paul lounge around her - some on the wet - others in chairs. Paul stares lovingly at Jay. She watches the horizon. Behind Jay - over her shoulder - we watch as Yara steps f the forest into view - far off - by the dirt road. Yara walks closer. Paul looks off - into her direction. Greg notices Kelly's leg - stretched across the grass. Sh sees him checking her out. His warm eyes cause her to loo away - more from shyness than anything else. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Greg gulps and finishes his beer as he stands - dropping can into the grass. He walks off - trudging towards the distant trees. Paul looks up at the sky - raising his hand up to feel th sun. Behind him, we see Yara in her bathing suit floating across the shallow edge of the lake on a circular inner-t She floats lazily by - a small but visible shape in the background. There are clearly two Yaras. One is in the water. One is approaching behind Jay. Paul looks back to Jay. She turns to her side and looks b towards the lake house. Behind her, Yara is now much clos continuing to approach.

dialogues.speaker: YARA
dialogues.text: You should get in the water! From her inner-tube, Yara looks back to her friends. Kell glances over to her sister. Jay yawns and stretches.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: You want to?

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: No. You go ahead. We see Greg - very far away - step into the trees, drop h shorts and start to pee.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Eh.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Get up. It'll be nice. Kelly starts to get up. We see the group, lounging togeth the field.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Maybe in a little bit.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Don’t be so lazy. As Jay sits in her chair, her long hair rises into the ai without cause or explanation - like a Michaél Borremans’ painting. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kelly and Paul see this occur. Jay immediately realizes something is behind her. She jumps from her chair, scream steps backwards. The chair topples. An invisible force pu her head down and prevents her from moving more than a fe feet. She pulls backwards - a tug of war - her hair is th rope.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Help me! Kelly takes a step closer - tentative with confusion.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Jay?! What is it?! Paul jumps up and grabs the fallen chair. He swings it do into the air. We watch as the chair smashes into an invisible object - cracking - hurting Paul's hand. Jay’s hair is released - dropping back to her shoulders. tumbles away, tripping over a cooler and falling to the ground. Kelly rushes to help her. Paul steps closer - suddenly he’s pushed violently across grass - landing on his shoulder. Jay crawls and stumbles away from the advancing thing. Th fake Yara follows her - bloodied but unfazed. In the distance, Greg quickly pulls up his shorts and sta to walk back - a cautious, hyper-aware gait.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Will you guys tell me what's goin' on?! The real Yara rushes through the shallow water and helps up. She pulls her towards the lake house as Paul manages stand, backing away from the center of the field - terrif and unsure how to help. Kelly runs after her sister. Jay keeps moving - glancing and pointing. Yara, or something that looks like her, follows. The gap widens, but the thing keeps coming. Slowly of course. Jay's friends and sister pass right by the thing as they to her aid. They see nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg is still far off - approaching along the edge of the clearing. We track behind him as he watches the odd sight Jay is backing away - screaming, pointing and staring at nothingness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay picks up the hand gun and runs to the door.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: What're you doing?! Jay raises the gun up. She aims at the thing. Yara stares back at her. Mouth open. Paul is almost hyper-ventilating at the edge of the room. sees nothing but a frightened and hurt young woman aiming gun into the air. He hides behind the couch. Jay waits until it gets near. She aims at its face - Jay pulls the trigger. Bang!!! Greg dives down - taking cover in the grass.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Fuck! The bullet slices through Yara’s forehead and ricochets o her temple. Blood pours from her skull as she slumps to t ground.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (in distance) Stop shooting! ! Greg jumps up, arms in the air. He starts to come closer.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Jay, please!! The bloody Yara rises and continues walking towards Jay a though nothing happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Greg moves toward Jay with his arms in the air, she ra her pistol once again. She fires several times - the bull coming right at us. Greg dives for cover. Jay steps back and pulls the front door closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay locks the front door and slumps onto the ground. She starts to cry. Kelly tries to hold her but she can't be consoled. Paul lifts his shirt and sees a swollen red welt across h abdomen. Jay peeks up toward the front window. She sees a large ma looking in through the glass. He shuffles slowly to the s out of sight. Smash!!! There's a loud pounding from the front door. The wood sha It hits again. The banging gets louder. A foot breaks through the bottom of the door. The women scream. Paul jumps in fear. Yara watches as wood splinters from the center - seemingl without cause. Jay watches as the foot kicks out a medium chunk of panel from the bottom of the door. The foot retracts and disappears. Silence - except for the soft crying within the room. The friends and siblings look to the door - waiting. Slowly... we push in... closer on the hole... Greg appears, looking in through the broken door - his he tilted at an angle.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: What the hell are you guys doing?!

dialogues.speaker: JAY YARA
dialogues.text: Greg, it's outside! Don’t open the door! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: What did you do to the door?!

dialogues.speaker: JAY PAUL
dialogues.text: It's trying to get in! We didn’t do it!

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: There's nothing out here!

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Yes there is! Greg pounds his fist into the door. He pulls away and disappears from view.

dialogues.speaker: GREG KELLY
dialogues.text: (O.S.) Greg, did you kick the door? What the fuck... son-of-a... Was it you? Silence. We hear only Jay, Kelly, Yara and Paul, breathing deeply. Frightened and labored breaths. Outside... it's quiet.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Greg? He doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Greg, are you ok? Jay leans closer to the door, peeking into the hole. Suddenly... A very LITTLE BOY WITH A STRANGE FACE pokes his head into opening. Jay screams and jumps as the little kid crawls through the hole in the door.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Jay, what do you see?! The innocent looking boy stares at Jay and screams loudly like an elderly woman. Jay flinches and covers her ears. She pulls herself up an scrambles away, grabbing the car keys from the table. There's a pounding from the other side of the house. Jay runs toward the rear door. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Now inside, the little boy steps across the room. Paul follows Jay as she unlocks the back door, revealing pounding on it.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: What is going on?!! Jay pushes past him, moving outside.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I don't know! Greg stares into the lake house with anger and confusion don't see anything other than hysterical teenagers.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (muttering to himself) What the fuck... Yara is crying on the floor, while Kelly stands shaking - shock. Greg marches past them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay runs to the car, fumbling with the key fob, unlocking door. As Jay climbs into the driver's seat, Greg emerges from t front door of the lake house. He inspects the crack in th door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starting the car, Jay sees a young woman, Annie, walk pas Greg and the others - staring at her from a distance. Greg is shouting - trying to calm everyone down. Jay continues to cry - not loudly - just streams of involuntary tears. She throws the car into gear. Kelly runs from the side of the house, spotting her siste the car.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: (distant) Jay! Wait! We back up at a mad speed, turning and racing up the dirt towards the highway. The engine roars - and whines. Kelly, Yara, Paul and Greg watch as Jay drives off. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Where are you going?! That's my fucking car!! The house, the friends and Annie recede into the backgrou Jay stares ahead in shock. Her hands are shaking on the steering wheel. The teenage girl presses down on the gas. She steers wide turning a corner in the road. Jay looks back over her shoulder. Panicked. Up ahead, a pickup truck begins to pull out from the intersection. Protected by a stop sign - nothing more. Jay is going too fast. Unable to stop. The truck tries to swerve. She pulls at the wheel, hitting the brake and cutting lef Losing control. She crashes hard into a bank of trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay opens her eyes. Her head is slightly bandaged around forehead. A small circle of dried blood rests on the cott wrap - an IV in her left arm. Her right arm is covered in a cast - extending from her fingers to her bicep. Jay sees the foot of her hospital bed. A monitor and the doorway leading to a hallway. She stares into the hall. An empty waiting room is visibl beyond another door. A NOSY WOMAN passes by - peeking over at Jay. An unseen MAN screams in pain from a distant room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody come and help me! I need some helppp! Somebody please! I just need some helppp!! Jay watches the door - she begins to frighten herself. He breathing grows shallow. She looks down and presses the call button. It rings, but one responds. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The hallway appears empty. The man's cries are silenced. call button beeps intermittently.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Hello? Jay stares into the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Helloooo? The camera moves closer and closer to the open space. Kelly steps into frame, walking from the waiting room aro the corner. She crosses the hall - an expression of sadne her face. Jay sees her coming. She stares - fearful and suspicious. breathing is heavy.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Kelly? Kelly simply nods and smiles reassuringly, shrugging her shoulders. Of course it's her. Jay doesn't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: (still afraid) Is it really you?!

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: (nodding once again) Yeah. It's me.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: (relieved) Ok. Jay tries to stop herself from crying. She sobs as her si comes closer and holds her - leaning down over the bed.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Does mom know?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Yeah. She came earlier.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: How long am I gonna be here?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I don't know. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: It's gonna come here. What am I gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: We're gonna figure it out. Just relax. Ok.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: How far are we from the lake house?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Far. Kelly sits up and yawns, pulling away from the hug. She l back revealing - An OLD NURSE staring down at Jay, a tray of food in her h Jay sees the pale woman and is startled. She immediately freaks out, pulling away and kicking her food tray to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: No! Get her away from me! Can you see her?! She's right there! Jay points at the nurse. Kelly tries to calm her sister, grabbing her arms.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I see her! It's just a nurse. She's bringing you food. (looking to the nurse) I'm so sorry... she's really scared. Jay turns her face toward the pillow. She takes deep brea

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: We'll get her something to help her relax.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: (mumbling) I don't want anything. Jay gasps for air. Everything goes dark... the noises of the hospital warp a distort... We hear the sound of Jay breathing.  100 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay opens her eyes again... She sees her mother sitting in a nearby chair. The door i closed. Paul, Greg, Kelly and Yara lay around the room - scattere odd places: chairs, the end of the bed, the window sill. The television is on, but no one is watching it. It's not but a half-muted light source in an otherwise dim room. We hear voices - whispering around us. Nothing sounds rig

dialogues.speaker: MRS HEIGHT
dialogues.text: (muted) Was she taking her medicine?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: (muted) I don't know. I think so. Jay begins to cry. Mrs. Height moves close, holding her hand against her daughter's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: MRS HEIGHT
dialogues.text: Jay, you ok? Jay's face shows exhaustion and fear. Her crying intensif The young woman sobs and wails like a hurt child. Her mot holds her, while Kelly wipes tears away from her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: (whispers) I don't wanna die.

dialogues.speaker: MRS HEIGHT
dialogues.text: You're not gonna die. You're ok. It was a bad accident. That's all. You'll be home in a few days. Jay continues to cry. Greg stares from his seat.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: (whispers) It's gonna catch me. Jay sees Greg. She looks to him for help. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: (whispers) It'll be here soon... Jay lays against her pillow, sobbing lightly, staring at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We watch from outside. The camera tracks along the exterior of the hospital wind past the sleeping and the sick. A man on his deathbed. A women hobbling to the bathroom. A family laughing silentl behind glass. A child eating over a tray. We settle on Jay's hospital room - looking in - through t window from a distance. Greg leans over the bed, as Jay whispers something into h ear. A private moment. He nods and says something in repl We slowly move closer. A tiny, creeping dolly forward. They are alone. The room's door is closed. Greg takes her left hand and holds it. He kisses her and moves closer. Greg undoes his pants and pulls them down. Jay lifts the blanket up and pulls her underwear off. Greg climbs into the bed with her, touching her body. She pulls his boxers off and holds him with one arm - keeping cast off to the side.. Greg moves on top of Jay. She looks up at him as he posit himself inside her. Greg stares down at Jay's beautiful f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay looks over Greg's shoulder to the closed door. She watches - waiting - as Greg makes love to her. Her head and face shake - rising and falling as the young moves faster - fucking her harder. Jay stays focused on the closed door - holding Greg in he arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay sits alone in her hospital bed. The room is very quie She stares out - lost in thought. Is it gone? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We sit with Jay for a few moments as she takes a sip of w and then looks down at her hospital gown. Her legs. The c on her arm. Jay waits for something to happen. She watches the empty doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg eats a sandwich, fries and coke while chatting with girls at a table. Many people cross by. Greg laughs with his mouth half-full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly rests on a small couch - magazines on her lap. Paul sits in a chair - watching across the hallway - look into Jay's room. He watches Greg smile and chat with her casually eating applesauce from Jay's food tray. Jay's face is partially hidden by the edge of the doorway Paul stares with obvious envy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flowers line the window sill - the sun shines brightly in

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: You haven't seen it?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Nothing. Greg takes another bite of applesauce.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (eating) Yeah. I'm waiting. Looking. It's been 3 days... Jay nods her head - unsure.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I don't think it's coming. Jay rests in her hospital bed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: You believe me right? You're not just playing along?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: No. I believe you. Jay nods.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I just don't think it's... following me. Jay stares at Greg. Worried.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Isn't that good?

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Jay's face doesn't seem relaxed. She takes no comfort in Greg's words.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about your car.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: It's just a car. He smiles and takes one more bite of applesauce - licking spoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay sits in the hot tub, with her cast hanging over the s looking out at the neighboring yards. A dullness in her e The back door is half-open. A small television rests on the deck - playing the local On the tv: Bodies are carried from a collapsed building. news announcer chatters away about the incident. Jay stares out at her backyard lawn - and the lawns of he neighbor's - yards stretching into infinity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay steps inside her house - drying off with a towel. It's quiet. She walks slowly down the hallway to her room.  109 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opening the bedroom door, Jay notices that her dresser dr is open. The underwear drawer. Looking across the room, she sees her bra, underwear and pair of socks laid out across her bed - as though mimicki body. Fear crosses her face.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Kelly!? Mom!? No one answers. Jay looks around for an intruder. Walking towards the bed, Jay passes a dresser, a mirror a various posters on the wall. She reaches the bed and picks up her bra. She leans down peers out the window. Nothing. Standing up, Jay sees a BOY reflected in the mirror. Star she screams - spinning around - falling back against the It's the 11 year old neighbor boy - hiding against the wa panties in his hand. He takes a step forward - arm extend worry on his face.

dialogues.speaker: NEIGHBOR BOY
dialogues.text: I just wanted to see you. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Get out of here!! The boy drops her underwear on the floor and runs out of room - into the hallway. Jay sits there. Catching her breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly and Paul sit on the porch talking, drinking and listening to music. Near the garage - Yara is chatting wi someone on her pink cell phone. Greg walks out from his front door. He crosses the street approaches the gang on the porch.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: How are you guys? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OK.
dialogues.text: Paul nods - choosing not to speak. Yara closes her phone and joins her friends - sitting dow near Paul.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: How's Jay? Greg looks in the direction of the house - where Jay is. shrugs her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Not great.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Have you seen anything? Paul stares Greg down - letting him know that he knows. Yara covers her tiny grin - they're all in on it. Greg silently shakes his head. Nope. The group is quiet for a moment as they consider this.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Is it cool if I go in?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I don't think so. She doesn't want to open her door. She's just hiding in there.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I thought she'd be doing better. Greg looks towards the closed doorway. Kelly stares at hi waiting for something back.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I can have her call you later.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Yeah ok. Paul watches silently - a brooding stare from the corner the porch.

dialogues.speaker: YARA
dialogues.text: You really haven't seen anything? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: She didn't make it up.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: We'll know sooner or later, right? Greg looks around - thinking about the possibility. He sc the empty street and the rows of manicured lawns extendin into infinity.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: That chair cracked in mid-air, something knocked me over, and the door... it didn't break on its own.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Something happened, but... it's not what she thinks.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: What do you think it was then? Greg shrugs his shoulders and steps off the porch.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I'll see you guys.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Bye, Greg.

dialogues.speaker: YARA
dialogues.text: Bye. Greg walks across the street. Paul watches him go - happy see him leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dark trees of the park sway in the night breeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dog barks from behind a fence. The houses sleep. The street is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the full neighborhood from above. Scattered house lights and street-lamps form pools of illumination across the flat Michigan suburbs.  114 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay sits by her window in pajamas, watching the dark neighborhood. Empty yards. A car passes. Jay yawns - a hand over her mouth. Near silence. Some crickets. Jay sees Greg walking slowly down the sidewalk. He turns heads up the path to his house. Jay knocks on her window, trying to get his attention. Greg reaches the front door, but it won't open for him. Jay watches - a bit confused. Greg picks up a large stone and walks towards the front w of his house. Jay realizes something is wrong. She grabs her 80’s hands phone and dials Greg's number. It goes straight to voice- mail. Greg breaks the glass and begins to crawl into his home through the opening. Jay leaps up and stumbles out her bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sprinting to Greg's front yard, Jay pounds on the door - at the handle.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Greg! Open the door! Greg! There's no sound from within. Jay looks to the broken fro window - she runs to it and begins to crawl through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Falling to the carpet, Jay clutches her cast-covered arm looks around the dark room. She stands up and moves throu the house.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: (cunning) Greg! It's in the house! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We hear a soft and distant tapping from above. A clock ch

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (O.S. - distant) Jesus, mom! I'm sleeping! Jay runs through a dark hallway reaching the base of the stairs. She goes up. INT. GREG’S HOUSE UPSTAIRS - CONTINUOUS 116A Running up the stairs, Jay hears the sound of knocking - louder. A "tap tap tap" on wood.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Greg! Watch out! Reaching the top of the stairwell, Jay stops. Ahead of he at Greg's door is his mother, Mrs. Hannigan. Mrs. Hannigan is knocking on the door. She looks over at as she continues to knock. Jay stares - suddenly understanding what's happening.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (from inside - groggy) What the fuck is going on? Fucking son- of-a...

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Greg, it's outside your...! Greg opens his bedroom door - wearing only boxers. He see his mother standing before him in her open bathrobe - bre half-exposed.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (groggy) What the fuck, mom? Mrs. Hannigan puts her arms around Greg. Her legs climb u feet clawing - wrapping herself around him. He falls back disappearing into the bedroom. Jay circles the doorway, looking in. She sees the woman straddling Greg, holding tightly as he convulses - his ey rolled back - revealing white and veins. A fallen lamp flickers and strobes. The room appears to shake. The mother pushes herself against Greg - bare legs - a lo robe - indecent. His hand struggles against hers - their fingers intertwined. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 116A CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 120 121 122 A heavy rush of fluid pours down onto Greg’s boxers - soa the carpet. The young man stops moving. He's dead and pale - his tong edging out the side of his mouth. The thing looks back at Jay and stands. It begins to foll her as she backs up along the hall landing - down the sta Jay runs to the front door - fleeing the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay pulls out of her driveway wildly. She drives down the street as Greg walks out of his front door - staring at h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay cruises along the expressway. She tries to slow her breathing. She wipes some tears from her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The radio is on. A beautiful pop song plays from the speakers. Jay is tired as she steers along the near empty expressway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet now. Heading down a rural highway. Jay pulls her car into a long dirt drive. She follows the tree-lined path deeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay parks and gets out of her car along the edge of some woods. She moves around the car and climbs over the front fender, sitting on the hood. Jay lays back and stares up at the night sky. She turns h head and watches the empty road - illuminated by a lone s lamp. She waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay sits on the roof of her car, facing the road. She sta out at the empty path. She hears something. A sputtering engine. Voices in the distance. Jay climbs down and follows the sound through the trees - toward the rising sun.  123 124 125 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stepping out of the woods, Jay finds herself along the ed Lake St. Claire. She looks out at the deep waters as a motorboat slows in the distance. A few shirtless YOUNG MEN drink beer in the boat as it ro and sways. Listening to music, they don't notice the youn woman on shore. Jay focuses on the men. A thought crosses her eyes. Jay takes off her pants and shirt as she steps into the l She moves out, bracing herself against the cold - letting cast drop carelessly into the water. She swims further. The boat is ahead. The young men grow closer and closer. Jay slows and stops. She's near the boat now. The music a laughter is louder. She looks up at the figures of men - considering. She starts to call out, but stops. Her eyes show melancholy as she paddles in place. I can't do this. Jay exhales and drops down into the water. She's gone. We sit on the surface of the lake watching the young men the boat drink and laugh. Eventually, they start the engi and cruise off along the horizon. A flock of birds fly overhead. The water is still. Jay pops up several yards away - nearly out of frame - ga for air. She fights to swim back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay drives the car down her street - her hair still damp cast soaking wet. As she pulls into her driveway, she see Kelly and Yara sitting on the porch - haggard and sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay is resting on the floor of the darkened room. A towel wrapped around her cast. Some light peeks in through the drawn shades. Kelly and Yara are sleeping on the bed - pa out - a space of mourning. Yara snores a little. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The old sandwich sits untouched on its plate. The bread h grown moldy. The pickle is dry. The Doritos remain orange unchanged. The television is on. Old commercials sell products. There's a knock at the door. Jay opens her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Paul.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Hang on. Jay gets up and pulls the chair away from the door, she cautiously opens it, peeking out into the hallway. She se Paul - alone. He steps into the room. Jay quickly closes the door and barricades it. Paul sits down on the floor next to Jay's nest of blanket clothes. She sits alongside him, pulling her t-shirt down she stretches her legs across the blanket with little reg for modesty. Her focus is singular - a melancholy has set in her eyes. They sit in silence together for a moment. Yara's snoring quietly rattles from the mattress.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: It's gonna be here sooner or later. Paul takes a breath - he's thought about it. He speaks in whispers.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: You could pass it on. Jay shakes her head. She won't. Not again.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: You did once.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: I shouldn't have. Jay looks ahead at the black dress slung over her chair.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I could... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jay looks at Paul - direct eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: No. A moment passes. Paul stares at Jay's profile. She watche the window.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I liked you too, ya know. Jay takes a breath, fidgeting with her t-shirt. She knows

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Why did you pick Greg? Jay looks down at her legs. She pulls them closer to her chest - she taps her knee lightly.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: I thought he would be ok. (beat) He wasn't scared. Paul listens.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: We slept together in high school. It wasn't a big deal. Paul nods - not agreeing but feeling the need to respond somehow. He leans in and starts to kiss Jay. She pulls away immediately. Paul reaches over and touches Jay’s fingers - extended ju beyond the edge of the damp cast. She maintains her gaze the window - with a soft sigh - exhaling tension.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I wanna help you. Paul caresses Jay's hand. She stares off - disconnected f his touch.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Yeah. I do. Jay pulls her hand away slowly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Paul takes a deep breath. He looks around the dim room. I messy now. Clothes are scattered. A dirty and tangled shirt hangs from the hamper. A bra si on the floor - half covered by a dirty tennis shoe. Kelly's hand hangs from the edge of the bed. Jay crawls over to the window and peeks out. She watches street through the low hanging branches of the trees as t sway. A kid rides past the house on his bike. Greg's front window is covered with plywood. There’s a po car parked in his driveway. Jay begins to cry - she’s giv up. Paul watches her - crouched and scared at the window's ed He notices her underwear at the bottom of her taut shirt. The young man looks away in frustration. A deep exhale. H holds his gaze against the far wall - noticing an old pho taped to the mirror. It's a picture of he and Jay - younger - standing togethe with wet hair and bathing suits by an old indoor pool. Sm - beers in hand.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Jay?

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: (still staring out the window) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Do you trust me? Jay nods and turns to Paul - ready to hear.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Well... do you remember where we were the first time we kissed? Jay nods yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay climbs into the passenger seat - behind her we see Ya and Kelly getting into the back and putting on their seat belts. Paul closes the trunk and climbs into the driver’s seat. Outside, the neighbor boys are playing ball in the front They steal glances towards the car and Jay. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: You know where to go? *

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I know how to get there. Mostly.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: YARA
dialogues.text: I haven't been to the pool since I was 14.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Who brought you? Yara kicks Paul’s seat - not smiling. *

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Ok. Paul starts the car and begins to back up. He throws his over the passenger seat and guides the car backwards. Mus plays from the radio. As the car reverses, we see more and more of Jay's house roof is revealed. Jay is looking the opposite way. An OLD NAKED MAN is standing on the roof - looking down a Jay. No one sees him.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: That's where I had my first beer. I threw up that whole night.

dialogues.speaker: YARA
dialogues.text: Into the pool?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: No. Outside the car.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: And in the car.

dialogues.speaker: YARA
dialogues.text: Ewwww. Paul backs up to the edge of the driveway - waiting for c to pass.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Paul used to pee in it.

dialogues.speaker: YARA
dialogues.text: Disgusting. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Not really. Whatever. There’s chlorine. Jay glances back towards her house... On the roof, she sees the naked, wrinkled man with red ha standing on the edge - staring at her. He's fully upright shoulders out, standing on the roof. He doesn't move. He just watches her. Jay holds her breath in fear. Paul pulls into the street and puts the car in drive. Jay's view shifts as the car lurches around - rides the b of the soft curb. Paul accelerates and guides the car down the street. Jay turns away and stares ahead - tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We speed along Interstate 75 - going south. We see only t road racing towards us - scenery changing. The hum of the car engine. Deeper and deeper into the city we drive. Passing exit signs for mile roads. Ducking under rotting overpasses. Broken buildings wave from the edge of the expressway. Gu plants momentarily block out the harsh sun. Dangerous streets and alleyways loom along their path. The camera slowly rotates around, pointing back through t front windshield - revealing Paul behind the wheel. Jay s in the passenger seat. Kelly and Yara are in the back. Th kids are solemn and quiet. The hum of the road is hypnoti - tiring. They sit in silence as they drive on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Storefronts, boarded houses, rotting factories and empty fill the frame. Jay's car is parked along a fence near a boarded store-fr We move through the poor neighborhood - slowly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jay and the girls follow Paul - looking out at the half e neighborhood. Paul carries a large duffle bag over his shoulder - a sma television in hand. The girls have backpacks. Yara lugs a boom-box.

dialogues.speaker: YARA
dialogues.text: When I was a little girl my parents told me I wasn't allowed to go south of 8 mile. I didn't even understand what that meant. It wasn't until I got a little older that I realized that was where the city started and the suburbs ended. I started thinking how weird and shitty that was. I had to ask permission to go to the state fair with my best friend and her parents just because it was a few blocks past the border.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: My parents said the same thing to me. Everything is bare - revealed in the fading sunlight. A f young men hang-out on the street. They watch the kids as pass. A homeless man shuffles closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small figures in the darkness, Jay and her friends walk u a large stone structure at the edge of an inner-city neighborhood. Paul pulls open a loose window and begins to crawl inside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang steps into a large indoor pool room. An enormous ornate ceiling frames the giant swimming pool spanning th length of the building. It’s dark except for a few dim po lights and the glow from the upper story windows. Water reflections cross Jay’s face as she steps to the poolside - kneeling down along the tile in her shorts and shirt - bedclothes for a warm night.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: How long do you think it will be? Jay shakes her head. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: I don't know. Hours I bet. Jay dips her hand into the water and looks deeply through walls of the room - beyond the water and the brick.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: It's been a long time since we were here together. Jay nods her head, splashing the water gently.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: You kissed me right over there... I think.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Is that how you remember it?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Jay raises her brow - a sad smile on her face. Across the way, Kelly and Yara stretch out in the shiftin shadows of the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain clouds fill the skyline, changing the nature of the moonlit city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul pulls household irons, curlers and a radio from his duffle bag - rolls of extensions cords. Jay empties her backpack onto the ground. Yara places a s television near the edge of the pool. The girls string electrical cords across doorways, and un chairs toward the water. Plugging in tattered cords to dusty outlets. Along the edge of the room, Paul digs through a utility c - unearthing an old space heater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extension cords stretch and snake across the tile floor - leading to various small appliances placed precariously a the edges of the pool. Irons, curlers, radios and a tv - turned on. Quiet static and heat. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jay sits, scanning the area, waiting for it. Eyes steady the entrance. Yara stands further back - arms crossed - scuffing her sh nervously along the ground. She looks over at Jay with sympathetic eyes. Paul sits quietly. Kelly paces near the windows. Jay stares down at the ground, moving her fingers across grout and the tile. They wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the old building. Static. Quiet. Thunder rumbles in the distance. Lightning strikes beyond the tree-line - small wiry lines light in the ink-washed sky. A few drops of rain begin to fall. Gentle on the concrete Calm like the sound of waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now wearing her bathing suit - Jay climbs slowly down the ladder into the pool. Adjusting to the feel of water in darkness. Alone in this large body of water. Her friends watching f the edges. The sound of rainfall on windows - mixed with the gentle and tapping of pool water. Lightning strikes in the distance. A faint flash inside. Jay stands alone in the center of the pool, looking aroun the flickering shadows along the walls. Vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see rain drops falling in an off-rhythm pattern agains metal fence. The doors to the building are visible in the background. The rain begins to pour. Picking up pace. Rattling softly into the wild grass along the edge of the building. We see various angles of increasing rainfall.  97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay waits, alone in the pool - focused on the main entran Everyone is silent. She listens to the sounds of rain... the soft clatter of unseen machinery. Air ducts and pool reverberate. Jay scans the doorways - turning lightly within the water Watching. Tense. Shadows flicker along the walls. The reflections of water against stone. The camera pans across the giant space. The teenagers pos like figures within a grander painting. Positions have shifted minimally. Kelly sits near the pool’s edge - leaning back on her han palms flat against the cold and wet tile. Rain falls against one of the high windows - through whic outside light enters - creating descending drops of shado across the room. Paul leans against the side wall - watching - rubbing his injured side casually over his t-shirt. Across the way, Yara rests in one of the metal folding ch chewing on licorice - a foot tucked under a leg. Kelly looks to her sister, alone in the pool as she turns pivots. Seeing her older sister - afraid in this dark roo Kelly tries to hold in her sadness. Positioned behind Kelly, we watch Jay from a distance as stares into the emptiness - waiting for something to ente

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: (quietly) Oh my God. Jay looks like she's about to cry. She sees something terrible, although the area appears empty.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: It just walked into the room. It's right there. Jay points over to the entrance. We see nothing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: It's here?

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Right there! Jay points again. Her voice pitches awkwardly. She starts cry. Holding still, we watch the scene from behind Kelly's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Jay... what... do you see? Jay just stares ahead, seeing something we do not.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: I don’t wanna tell you.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Jay, I need you to point at it. Keep your finger aimed at it so we can see where it is. In a single wide shot - Jay lifts her left hand and aims across the room - tracking the thing.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Is it getting into the water?

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: No. It’s just standing there - looking at me. Kelly looks to Paul - concerned.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Ok... um...

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: It’s moving. Jay turns slowly, her arm stretched out, pointing at the invisible thing. - tracking with it around the far corner the pool.

dialogues.speaker: YARA
dialogues.text: (frightened) What’s it doing?

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Walking. Walking closer. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jay continues to pivot in the water, stepping back from t edge nearest her invisible pursuer. Creating distance. As Jay points along the pool’s side, Yara steps back cautiously, bumping into some chairs - moving away from I path.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Paul, I wanna get out.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Just wait. Give it a minute.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: No, I don’t wanna do this. I just wanna get out of the water. Suddenly a metal folding-chair rises six feet in the air. moves back and then flies into the pool with force - stra at Jay. Splash!

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Jay! Jay jumps to the side, avoiding the chair as it sinks to bottom. * Water swirls around us as we surface. Jay splashes and li her head for air. She sees a NEARLY-NAKED MIDDLE-AGED MAN SALT AND PEPPER HAIR walking along the perimeter of the p He’s staring at her, wearing nothing but underwear. The man grabs another chair and throws it at Jay. She div the side and dodges it. Falling deeper into the water. Coughing and gasping.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Help! Paul, Kelly and Yara circle the pool, reaching out for Ja waving for her to swim in their direction. Screaming - shouting. Jay rushes toward the edge. It throws another chair at he striking her in the shoulder - causing her to fall below water. *

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: No! Jay surfaces, holding herself in pain. * (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She sees the man pick up a small television - still conne to the outlet by an extension cord. He prepares to throw offering her an odd smile. Jay braces herself for a shock, covering her face from th projectile. The tv flies through the air - hurled reckles

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Jay!!!! The tv misses Jay, but splashes down nearby - pulling wit the slack from the orange extension cord. The outside lights flicker, but there are no sparks. No s Jay is ok. She looks back, realizing she’s still alive and breathing

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: You OK?

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: YARA
dialogues.text: (smiling with relief) It didn’t work.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Thank Godddd.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: (to Jay)) Just keep pointing at it! Jay paddles, pointing at the man while crying - trying to catch her breath. Yara and Kelly hover in the background, screaming and shouting for information.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Where is it?! Paul clumsily pulls the pistol from his bag, and runs in direction that Jay’s pointing. He aims the gun along the of the pool walkway. We see no monsters. No strange men. An old set of pink electric curlers fly into the water - kicked by something unseen.

dialogues.speaker: SPLASH
dialogues.text: Paul fires in the general direction of the curlers - taki guess.

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: You missed it!

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Where is it? For an instant we see IT from Jay's POV. The man stares a her, but swings his hand out at Paul, reaching for him wi violent shake and tremor.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Watch out! Don't get too close. The man throws another old appliance into the water, stra at Jay. It misses her as the cord drops below the surface Yara circles, keeping her distance from the approaching I Paul moves back and tries to aim. Once more, we see thing from his POV: Jay madly pointing her finger from within t water.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: It's there! Paul fires again. Across the pool, the bullet slices into Yara's leg.

dialogues.speaker: YARA
dialogues.text: Abhbh. Yara falls onto the ground - unnoticed by everyone.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: No! It... missed!

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Where?! Here?! Here?

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: No! Right there! Jay swings her hand, trying to direct the weapon by proxy Paul tries to slowly adjust the direction of his gun. The man grabs a household iron from the edge of the pool. Paul fires. Yara screams in fright.

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: Jay sees the shot connect with the man’s left thumb and i finger - severing them. The flesh flies off and drops int pool. Blood spouts. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kelly pulls an old bed-sheet from her backpack. Gaudy col swirling roses and a few large stains. She unfolds the sheet, whipping it across the air. As it drifts down, a stain is visible across the center. With his right hand, the man hurls the iron into the wate hitting Jay’s side below the surface. She crumples. * Paul tries to find a target. *

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Where is it?! Moving along the pool’s edge, Kelly flags the sheet outwa letting it drift. It catches on something. She lets go an drops it down. The sheet collects over the moving figure man - revealing the thing walking amongst them. A person an old worn sheet. Yara gasps at the sight of it - shuffling past her. Paul tries to steady his aim. He fires at IT.

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: Jay watches as a shot slices through the man’s head - cov by the old sheet. The bullet emerges from the other side. Blood sprays like vapor - constant and strong. The impact causes the man to stumble forward. The geyser blood from his head tips with him. He falls into the pool emotion - no pain.

dialogues.speaker: SPLASH
dialogues.text: The sheet spreads along the surface, dropping down at the edges - waterlogged. Jay quickly wades through the water toward Paul, Kelly an Yara - hands outstretched at the side of the pool. Almost there... something pulls Jay below the surface. Underwater - a hand is grasped tightly around Jay’s ankle kicks and fights. Gasping for air... there’s only water... Jay thrashes and struggles. Snaking extension cords - orange, white and brown - lead into the depths of the water - anchored by small domestic appliances - a toaster, a television, irons, curlers and chairs - dotting the bottom - littering the pool. + eH (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kelly and Paul’s POV - they watch as Jay is pulled deeper underwater - kicking and fighting against nothing. Yara wails loudly nearby. Paul raises the gun toward the water. Jay's POV - Jay continues to struggle underwater. The man holds her tightly by the ankle. We watch from a distance, debris of appliances and wires framing their fight. A bullet trail forms through the water, zipping past Jay the man. Then another. A third trail strikes the man in the back, releasing a la swirl of blood. He let’s go of Jay and she swims upward. Paul and Kelly pull Jay from the water, dragging her onto ground. Coughing and choking, she crawls further along th tile - in terrible pain. Her ankle is covered in a red rash. Jay sits, soaking wet, on the floor, clutching her ankle cast hangs limp to her side. A moment of silence. Coughing and crying. Kelly holds tightly to Yara's bleeding leg. We hear the rain on the windows and some thunder claps ab Paul looks down into the clear pool water - seeing only t extension cords and household objects. We don’t see the I its blood.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Jay, do you see it? Is it still down there? Jay peers over the edge. We watch from above as Jay stares down into the pool. Ins of water, we see only deep red blood. Everything below th surface is obscured by the dense liquid. A pool of blood. As Jay stares in horror, we hear a cacophony of sounds - screeches and sirens - laughter and grunting - a birthing scream - children yelling - her mother’s laughter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chair is propped against the door. Jay and Paul are laying on the couch - an old blanket cov their bodies. Jay looks into his eyes and waits for a sign. He nods his with love and anticipation. Jay moves on top of him - sitting up, pulling the blanket herself. They fumble underneath and begin to make love. Paul nervously touches her face. Staring up lovingly. She kisses him - holding her cast to her side. They stare into each others eyes. For the first time they thinking only of each other. A moment of connection through the physical. Rain against basement window. They move slowly with pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: I feel like I’m hurting you. Paul looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: You’re not. Jay nods and continues. She pushes harder against him - exhaling - smiling down a him. Paul stares at Jay’s face. We watch from across the room now. The quiet basement. A thunderstorm outside. The young lovers on an old couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrapped in the blanket, holding each other, Jay and Paul Faces close together. Whispering.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Do you feel any different? Jay shakes her head. No.

dialogues.speaker: JAY
dialogues.text: Do you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: No. Jay kisses Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay lays under her sheets - a cartoon bandaid across her temple - a new cast on her arm. Mrs. Height sits on the e of the bed, rubbing her back. Softly. On the dresser, we see a glass of wine and an old family portrait. Jay is a young girl. Kelly is a baby. Their mother, young and pretty smiles alongside Jay's father, a middle-aged man with salt and pepper hair. He grins happi into the camera. His smile is identical to the one he off Jay at the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul drives through a run-down neighborhood within the in city. He stares at a row of prostitutes. Tight skirts. Revealing tops. They eye him. Paul watches them as he passes. The women appear to move in slow motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay sits across from Paul in Yara’s hospital room. He lay back in a chair - eyes closed and napping. Yara is eating in bed, as she reads something from her ph

dialogues.speaker: YARA
dialogues.text: (veading with food in her mouth) “When there is torture there is pain and wounds, physical agony, and all this distracts the mind from mental suffering, so that one is tormented only by the wounds until the moment of death." Yara pauses to take a sip of milk through a straw - noisi she slurps. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: YARA
dialogues.text: (taking a bite of food) “The most terrible agony may not be in the wounds themselves but in knowing for certain that within an hour, then within ten minutes, then within half a minute, now at this very instant - your soul will leave your body and you will no longer be a person, and that this is certain; the worst thing is that it is certain." Jay looks at Paul's handsome face. She tilts her head a b watching the young man at rest. Yara takes another large bite of food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several groups of inner-city children laugh and play in t clean water of the old pool. The rumble of the sound-trac suggests something ominous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond the barren trees of the middle-class suburban neighborhood, the concrete towers of a nuclear power plan visible in the distance. Smoke rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue light from distant lamps shines a cold glow over the empty park. The trees are now barren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead but colorful leaves cover the ground. We move forwar along the sidewalk. Up ahead, a man rakes his front yard. A few children buil fort out of the fallen leaves. Lines of red and orange ac the grass. Jay and Paul hold hands as they walk together through the neighborhood. The cast is gone. Far behind them, a teenager in a coat marches slowly alon edge of the road. Jay smiles to Paul and he smiles back. They stare out at autumnal suburbia - pretty and clean.
